segment.source: Domain isolation (as described in the previous goal Restrict Access to Only Trusted Devices) prevents devices that are members of the isolated domain from accepting network traffic from untrusted devices.
segment.target: Domain isolation (as described in the previous goal Restrict Access to Only Trusted Devices) prevents devices that are members of the isolated domain from accepting network traffic from untrusted devices.

segment.source: However, some devices on the network might host sensitive data that must be additionally restricted to only those users and computers that have a business requirement to access the data.
segment.target: However, some devices on the network might host sensitive data that must be additionally restricted to only those users and computers that have a business requirement to access the data.

segment.source: Windows Firewall with Advanced Security enables you to restrict access to devices and users that are members of domain groups authorized to access that device.
segment.target: Windows Firewall with Advanced Security enables you to restrict access to devices and users that are members of domain groups authorized to access that device.

segment.source: These groups are called network access groups (NAGs).
segment.target: These groups are called network access groups (NAGs).

segment.source: When a device authenticates to a server, the server checks the group membership of the computer account and the user account, and grants access only if membership in the NAG is confirmed.
segment.target: When a device authenticates to a server, the server checks the group membership of the computer account and the user account, and grants access only if membership in the NAG is confirmed.

segment.source: Adding this check creates a virtual "secure zone" within the domain isolation zone.
segment.target: Adding this check creates a virtual "secure zone" within the domain isolation zone.

segment.source: You can have multiple devices in a single secure zone, and it is likely that you will create a separate zone for each set of servers that have specific security access needs.
segment.target: You can have multiple devices in a single secure zone, and it is likely that you will create a separate zone for each set of servers that have specific security access needs.

segment.source: Devices that are part of this server isolation zone are often also part of the encryption zone (see Require Encryption When Accessing Sensitive Network Resources).
segment.target: Devices that are part of this server isolation zone are often also part of the encryption zone (see Require Encryption When Accessing Sensitive Network Resources).

segment.source: Restricting access to only users and devices that have a business requirement can help you comply with regulatory and legislative requirements, such as those found in the Federal Information Security Management Act of 2002 (FISMA), the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA), and other government and industry regulations.
segment.target: Restricting access to only users and devices that have a business requirement can help you comply with regulatory and legislative requirements, such as those found in the Federal Information Security Management Act of 2002 (FISMA), the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA), and other government and industry regulations.

segment.source: You can restrict access by specifying either computer or user credentials.
segment.target: You can restrict access by specifying either computer or user credentials.

segment.source: This goal, which corresponds to Server Isolation Policy Design, provides the following features:
segment.target: This goal, which corresponds to Server Isolation Policy Design, provides the following features:

segment.source: Isolated servers accept unsolicited inbound network traffic only from devices or users that are members of the NAG.
segment.target: Isolated servers accept unsolicited inbound network traffic only from devices or users that are members of the NAG.

segment.source: Isolated servers can be implemented as part of an isolated domain, and treated as another zone.
segment.target: Isolated servers can be implemented as part of an isolated domain, and treated as another zone.

segment.source: Members of the zone group receive a GPO with rules that require authentication, and that specify that only network traffic authenticated as coming from a member of the NAG is allowed.
segment.target: Members of the zone group receive a GPO with rules that require authentication, and that specify that only network traffic authenticated as coming from a member of the NAG is allowed.

segment.source: Server isolation can also be configured independently of an isolated domain.
segment.target: Server isolation can also be configured independently of an isolated domain.

segment.source: To do so, configure only the devices that must communicate with the isolated server with connection security rules to implement authentication and check NAG membership.
segment.target: To do so, configure only the devices that must communicate with the isolated server with connection security rules to implement authentication and check NAG membership.

segment.source: A server isolation zone can be simultaneously configured as an encryption zone.
segment.target: A server isolation zone can be simultaneously configured as an encryption zone.

segment.source: To do this, configure the GPO with rules that force encryption in addition to requiring authentication and restricting access to NAG members.
segment.target: To do this, configure the GPO with rules that force encryption in addition to requiring authentication and restricting access to NAG members.

segment.source: For more information, see Require Encryption When Accessing Sensitive Network Resources.
segment.target: For more information, see Require Encryption When Accessing Sensitive Network Resources.
